```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
energy <- sample(10:99, 1) # (J)
charge <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # (C)

ans <- signif(energy / charge, 2)  # voltage
dis <- c(energy * charge, charge / energy)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("%g V", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
It takes $`r energy` \,\mathsf{J}$ of energy to move $`r charge` \,\mathsf{C}$ of
charge from point $A$ to point $B$. What is the potential difference between points $A$ and $B$?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
The electric potential difference (voltage) is the energy per charge:

$$V = \frac{E}{Q} = \frac{`r energy` \,\mathsf{J}}{`r charge` \,\mathsf{C}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{V}$$
